summary: This bill, H.R. 282, introduced in the U.S. House of Representatives on January 9, 2025, proposes naming a federal facility to honor a local figure. The legislation directs that the United States Postal Service building located at 107 North Hoyne Avenue in Fritch, Texas, be officially designated as the "Chief Zeb Smith Post Office." The bill, which has numerous bipartisan cosponsors from the Texas delegation, further stipulates that all official U.S. government records, maps, and documents must refer to the facility by this new name.
